title: Engineering & Operations Lead Job at Sub-Sea 9 Gas Limited
content:
At Sub-Sea 9 Gas Limited, we're building a clean energy future through the development of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) plants across Nigeria. Our new plant in Calabar is designed to unlock gas accessibility through modern infrastructure and mobile distribution systems, enabling lower-emission alternatives for industries, transport services, and underserved regions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering & Operations Lead
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Calabar, Cross River
Job Type: Full Time
Career level: Mid-to-Senior Level
Role Category: Engineering | Plant Operations | Maintenance | Business Development | Gas Distribution

About the Role


	We are seeking a hands-on, result-driven Engineering & Operations Lead to support the development and manage the technical and operational life cycle of our new CNG gas plant.
	This is a key technical role bridging engineering execution and plant operations. It spans from early-stage engineering and construction support to full ownership of operational and technical performance, maintenance planning, and product distribution.
	The ideal candidate combines strong engineering expertise, proven operational leadership, in-depth knowledge of plant maintenance, and the ability to support product sales and distribution planning.


Responsibilities
Development Phase:


	Support project planning, risk management, and cost control.
	Provide engineering support during the design, procurement, and construction of the plant.
	Review engineering drawings and documentation, equipment specifications, and vendor proposals to ensure alignment with operational goals.
	Assist in the evaluation and onboarding of key equipment vendors and technical service providers.
	Develop SOPs and operation and maintenance manuals in coordination with contractors and project teams.
	Present technical concepts and updates to executive leadership and partners.
	Collaborate with engineering, procurement, and construction contractors, vendors, and consultants.
	Liaise with regulatory agencies for approvals and licenses, and prepare all technical documentation for statutory permits.
	Contribute to research and development initiatives as well as continuous innovation.
	Ensure all deliverables are completed on time, within budget, and in line with project goals.
	Ensure compliance with safety, environmental, and operational standards.
	Lead the preparation of the commissioning schedule, test procedures, and validate key performance indicators.


Operations & Maintenance:


	Lead the day-to-day operational activities of the gas plant, ensuring safe, reliable, efficient operations and optimal system performance.
	Lead daily staff operations, shift management, inventory tracking, loss control, and vendor coordination.
	Develop a strong team with the highest safety & technical performance.
	Supervise plant personnel and ensure compliance with Health, Safety, and Environmental regulations.
	Monitor and troubleshoot system issues in real time to optimize plant efficiency and reliability.
	Plan preventive maintenance schedules, ensuring a swift response to all faults or issues at all times.
	Perform routine and preventive maintenance on compressors, PRS, pumps, valves, meters, rotating equipment, and various other machines and equipment.
	Conduct regular inspections of CNG systems, electrical equipment, and components to identify issues, hazards, defects, and the need for adjustments or repairs.
	Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical and electrical problems with CNG systems, engines, and other related components.
	Maintain accurate records of maintenance and repair work performed at all times.
	Maintain and update reports, operating procedures, manuals, and technical documentation.
	Maintain high standards of fuel quality, gas purity, cylinder integrity, and workplace safety.
	Provide training and support to plant staff on CNG instrumentation and controls.
	Ensure all regulatory permits and licenses are acquired, maintained, and updated as required by law.
	Ensure compliance with industry standards, health, safety, and environmental regulations in the plant.
	Stay updated on advancements in CNG technology and maintenance techniques.


Commercial & Product Support:


	Identify and qualify new business leads to expand the market reach.
	Provide technical support for customers' onboarding and product delivery.
	Monitor market trends and client feedback to identify areas for operational or technical improvements.
	Work closely with marketing and sales teams to develop and support new business opportunities from a technical and supply standpoint.
	Collaborate with the commercial team to align production with sales forecasts, customer demands, and the distribution schedule.
	Support product pricing strategies by providing technical input on distribution costs, operational efficiency, and supply reliability.
	Oversee the integration of metering and billing systems to ensure accurate product measurement and invoicing.
	Implement and monitor telemetry or SCADA systems for tracking product movement, trailer performance, and delivery conditions.
	Assist in developing technical proposals for commercial clients, including capacity, delivery options, and performance parameters.
	Review and approve technical aspects of supply contracts, including delivery terms, specifications, and quality standards.
	Engage with major customers and distributors to address technical queries, resolve issues, and strengthen service delivery.
	Ensure the safe and efficient loading process of CNG via real-time pressure, temperature, and flow control systems.
	Design and implement safety procedures and emergency response plans for gas distribution and mobile asset handling.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s or Master’s in Mechanical, Chemical, Petroleum, or Process Engineering, or related degree.
	8–10 years of experience in energy, gas processing, CNG infrastructure, and industrial plant operations.
	Experience in project execution and operational management.
	Strong knowledge of CNG/LPG systems, gas compression systems, process equipment, and plant utilities is highly preferred.
	Experience with SCADA, telemetry, and industrial control systems to support real-time monitoring, automation, and efficient plant operations.
	Great attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and ability to follow safety protocols.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills across technical and non-technical teams.
	Working knowledge of HSE standards and regulatory compliance in Nigeria’s energy sector.
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic, project-driven environment.
	Proven track record in plant operations, maintenance, and safety standards.
	Proficiency in troubleshooting and diagnostic procedures for mechanical, electrical , and process systems with accuracy and speed.
	Understanding and ability to design engineering drawings, P&IDs, and process flow diagrams.
	Prior experience managing or working in industrial gas production is highly desirable.
	Proven experience in leading cross-functional teams with a strong emphasis on accountability, performance delivery, and operational discipline.
	Experience collaborating with sales, distribution, or logistics teams to support end-to-end product delivery is a strong advantage.
	Understanding of the Nigerian gas market, client needs, and product logistics is a plus.
	Willing to be based full-time in Calabar, assuming full operational and technical ownership of site activities.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary package commensurate with experience..
	Performance-based bonuses or incentives.
	Health insurance and wellness coverage.
	Growth opportunities within a fast-growing energy company.
	Access to industry training, certifications, and technical development programs.
	The opportunity to shape the future of clean gas access in Nigeria.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@sub-sea9gas.com using "Engineering and Operations Lead" as the subject of the email.

title: Store Manager Job at FoyinHR
content:
FoyinHR, a reliable, growning IT Company, is  recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Manager

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: General Manager

Job Description


	Your Job is to manage all aspects of day to day store operations to ensure that customers and business expectations are met and/or exceeded within the business strategy.
	You are also responsible for creating brand visibility and managing same by creating a lasting impression on the Customer.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure the outlet is opened for business operations as scheduled on a daily basis
	Maintain outlet ambience in line with best practices for cleanliness, arrangement,
	music and other requirements.
	Induction and training of new associates on policies, procedures, products and
	services
	Train and develop team member capabilities for effective service delivery in line with
	customer, company and brand expectations
	Daily banking operations in line with cash management policies and procedures
	Develop local sales strategy in line with global strategy and techniques to enrich the
	customer’s experience
	Recommend sales strategy in line with local customer behavior and/or trends in order to ensure that all set sales targets are met
	Monitor delivered merchandise, ensure stock taken is accurate and maintain reorder
	levels in line with trends and customer preferences
	Recording daily transactions, daily stock and financial bank reconciliation
	Inventory & Promotions: Keep accurate records of store goods, sales figures, requests,
	discounts and markdowns
	Preparing daily, weekly and monthly reports. May have to submit other unscheduled reports
	Build, manage and maintain customer database for CRM purposes
	Keep customers abreast of store products, discounts, promotions and services
	Manage store expenses, avoid waste of company resources, be alert for securities breaches like customer theft
	Effectively manage own team to ensure store/outlet sales targets are met
	Ensure uniformity and consistency of brands in-store
	Ensure staff maintain a professional working environment at all times
	Other duties as assigned by management


Qualifications


	BSc in Business Administration or any related field
	3 years of experience required or experience in a managerial post is a plus
	Retail training will be an advantage.


Salary
N250,000 / month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: foyinoluwa@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
